ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overview of 20th century's most important European social science and philosophical liture. Highly recommended if you want to get a good overview.
I would definitely recommend this to any theorist, or anyone who wants to get a grasp on continental philosophy.

Yes. I would recommend this to anyone and everyone. Even if you don't understand everything--it is a very high level--still just take this course. Of course if you are in polisci or phil you are stupid not to take it.
This course will give you an overview of the great themes of 20th century Europe. It will introduce you to problems of great relevance to today. If you care about ideas, take it.
Yes. It can be a bit exhausting. The class time and the readings are long.
go to these lectures, all of them
Great in-depth introduction to political theory. Will really provide you with the historical context, and open you to probably previously unknown subject-matter.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Was great to have these major works explained by Benhabib, she's great in making difficult literature accessible.
The course provides an excellent overview of contemporary, continental philosophy.
I'm a political theorist working on contemporary continental theory- so, yes, this course prepared me in countless ways.
Better if you have already had some background in the more "convention" narrative of american constitutional law.
Provided me a background in political theory which will help me be a more well-rounded political scientist.
